Text: try neuview pro 6.0 protable you want belive your eyes i took it here about a year ago find it and give it a shot it worth it thanks anyway

@ rhaoul

thanks for the tip, Neuview looks promising at first glance, but it utilizes the old Codecs, which is required to be installed on your system. 

The reason i like SPlayer, VLC, and the like: is the innovative 'Binary Codecs' technology. It bypasses the need to install Codec Packs, which do more harm than good. Download 'Autoruns', take a look at what's installed before and after installing any Codec Pack. It's outrageous! When you install Codec Packs, it's loaded at every system boot, regardless if it's needed, which increases boot time, and Codec Conflict is common.

Which is why i prefer SPlayer.
i will give it a try  the only codec i use window7 codec pack  that was the only one i tried and works good to but i will give a try to this one to thanks
